Description: Herbalife International of America, Inc., Herbalife International, Inc., and Herbalife, Ltd. agreed to fully restructure their U.S. business operations and pay $200 million to compensate consumers to settle Federal Trade Commission charges that the companies deceived consumers into believing they could earn substantial money selling diet, nutritional supplement, and personal care products.

Herbalife agreed to pay $3 million in restitution to settle allegations it made false and misleading claims about a multi-level marketing scheme. This was in conjunction with but separate from a nationwide Federal Trade Commission settlement.

The Securities and Exchange Commission announced that Herbalife Nutrition Ltd., a direct selling company with operations in over 90 countries, agreed to pay $20 million to settle charges that it made false and misleading statements about its China business model in numerous U.S. regulatory filings over a six-year period.

Herbalife Nutrition Ltd. agreed to pay criminal penalties of $55 million to resolve the government's Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of Herbalife's scheme to falsify books and records and provide corrupt payments and benefits to Chinese government officials for the purpose of obtaining, retaining, and increasing Herbalife's business in China.

Herbalife Nutrition Ltd. agreed to pay $67 million to settle charges that it violated the books and records and internal accounting controls provisions of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act through the actions of its Chinese subsidiaries.
